results.title: The Vietnam War : unknown images
results.creator_credit: Isabelle Clarke, Andrew McDonald and INA France
results.brief_description: 25 years after the end of the Vietnam War, some of the conflict’s most harrowing images can be seen in this documentary. Long forgotten pictures rediscovered in American Army archives, censured for their violence, or restricted by military secrecy. Unedited, identified by clapperboard, this raw material depicts war in its routine, the eye of the camera capturing a crack fighting force, from the world’s most powerful nation, in disintegration.

results.title: The Victorian State Schools' Nursery
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry, Cineservice and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Many Victorian schools are noted for their fine gardens. They are supplied by the State Schools’ Nursery at Huntingdale. Here teachers and students receive instruction in horticulture. Commentator: Ray Chapman

results.title: The Victor Kelleher video
results.creator_credit: Mark Waters, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Noted children’s author Victor Kelleher talks frankly of how his homesickness for Africa led him to writing - “In a way I stumbled into writing. I didn’t go looking for a writing career. It found me.” He explains how a dream from his youth and a visit to the zoo with his child led to the novel “Taronga”; a relative talking of his childhood, the inspiration behind “Del-Del”. Settings also play an important role in his work as well as being a source of inspiration; the Zambezi Valley to “Papio” for example. The author explains the role of characters in his writing, where the inspiration comes from, writers block, interests and hobbies that have influenced his work (Where the whales sing, Parkland, Slow burn), and reads from various novels. A teacher’s guide accompanies the tape.

results.title: The VFL 1st semi final: [Richmond vs Geelong 1969]
results.brief_description: First semi final 1969, Richmond vs Geelong. Film shows third and fourth quarters at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with final scores Richmond 25 goals 17 behinds 167 points defeating Geelong 7 goals 7 behinds 49 points.

results.title: The Very hungry caterpillar and other stories = The World of Eric Carle
results.creator_credit: Andrew Goff, Iain Harvey, Illuminated Film Company and Scholastic Productions
results.brief_description: Five animated stories from famous children’s author Eric Carle. In “The Very hungry caterpillar,” a caterpillar born on a Sunday eats a little more each day of the week but never seems to have his appetite satisfied. Until next Sunday that is, when he builds himself a cocoon. “Papa, please get the moon for me”: Before she goes to bed, little Monica looks out the window and spies the moon, longing to play with it, but try as she might, she can’t reach it, and asks her papa for help. “The Very quiet cricket”: A baby cricket struggles to answer the call of other insects; when he rubs his legs together there’s no sound. “The Mixed-up chameleon”: An unhappy chameleon, unsure of what he wants to be, seeks inspiration from creatures at the zoo. “I See a song”: A violinist plays notes that manifest themselves as a morphing array of colours, shapes and images. Stories narrated by Roger McGough and Juliet Stevenson. Music by Julian Nott.
